[ Package Index | Mudlib Index | Effect Index ]

File /global/guild-race.c

This file contains all the information relating to guilds and races that is stored on the player.

Written by Pinkfish

Includes

This class includes the following files /include/command.h, /include/player.h and /include/playtesters.h

Method index

add_known_command(string)
This method adds a command to the player.
help_command(string)
This method handles help calls associated with commands on the player.
query_gtitle()
This method returns the title associated with this player for their guild.
query_guild_data()
This method returns the current guild data for the player.
query_guild_ob()
This method returns the current guild object associated with the player.
query_known_command(string)
This method checks to see if the command is known by the player.
query_known_commands()
This method returns the array of commands the player knows.
query_race()
This method returns the name of the race associated with the player.
query_race_ob()
This method returns ther current race object associated with the player.
race_guild_commands()
This method adds all the guild and race commands to the player when they start up.
remove_known_command(string)
This method removes a command from the player.
set_guild_data(mixed *)
This method sets the data associated with the guild for the player.
set_guild_ob(string)
This method sets the current guild associated with the player.
set_race_ob(string)
This method sets the players current race.

Public Functions

These are functions that everyone can access.

.
add_known_command
int add_known_command(string str)
This method adds a command to the player.

Parameters:
str - the command to add
Returns:
1 if was successfuly added, 0 if not
See also:
query_known_commands(), query_known_command() and remove_known_command()
help_command
string help_command(string str)
This method handles help calls associated with commands on the player. This will either return a string or a function pointer.

Parameters:
str - the command to get help on
Returns:
the help for the command
See also:
add_known_command()
query_gtitle
string query_gtitle()
This method returns the title associated with this player for their guild.

Returns:
the guilds title
query_guild_data
mixed * query_guild_data()
This method returns the current guild data for the player.

Returns:
the current guild data
See also:
set_guild_data()
query_guild_ob
string query_guild_ob()
This method returns the current guild object associated with the player.

Returns:
the current guild object
See also:
set_guild_ob()
query_known_command
int query_known_command(string word)
This method checks to see if the command is known by the player.

Parameters:
word - the command to check
Returns:
1 if known, 0 if not
See also:
add_known_command(), query_known_commands() and remove_known_command()
query_known_commands
string * query_known_commands()
This method returns the array of commands the player knows.

Returns:
the list of commands the player knows
See also:
add_known_command(), query_known_command() and remove_known_command()
query_race
string query_race()
This method returns the name of the race associated with the player.

Returns:
the race name
See also:
query_race_ob() and set_race_ob()
query_race_ob
string query_race_ob()
This method returns ther current race object associated with the player.

Returns:
the race object
See also:
set_race_ob()
race_guild_commands
void race_guild_commands()
This method adds all the guild and race commands to the player when they start up.

See also:
add_known_command()
remove_known_command
int remove_known_command(string str)
This method removes a command from the player.

Parameters:
str - the command to remove
Returns:
1 if it was successful, 0 if it was unsuccessful
See also:
add_known_command(), query_known_command() and query_known_commands()
set_guild_data
void set_guild_data(mixed * dat)
This method sets the data associated with the guild for the player. This is used for stuff like the orders for wizards and the type of specialisation for theives.

Parameters:
dat - the data to associate with the guild
See also:
query_guild_data()
set_guild_ob
void set_guild_ob(string str)
This method sets the current guild associated with the player. Be very careful when setting this variable, if you get it wrong bunches of things on the mud will mysteriously break.

Parameters:
str - the new guild object
See also:
query_guild_ob()
set_race_ob
void set_race_ob(string str)
This method sets the players current race. This should never be used, all players should be humans. the set functions should not be called indisciminately... Be careful when using them, so that you don't screw up a character ok?

Parameters:
str - the players new race
See also:
query_race_ob()
